name: Drury Inn & Suites - Sikeston

reviews.text: When we called the Sikeston Drury direct, we already expected something very nice; and it was just that in every respect. The place is brand spanking new, and I couldn't find fault with any aspect of our stay. The ladies were thrilled with room size, granite counter tops, and oversize furniture. Free wireless internet was lightning fast, and they give you an hour of fee long distance each day you stay there.
reviews.title: First Class All the Way!

reviews.text: Happy hour when we checked in, and breakfast were just downright delightful when compared to the usual motel fare of Cheerios and cold danish.
reviews.title: Brand new hotel, excellent breakfast

reviews.text: We left fully fed and extremely well rested, and would return without any hesitation.
reviews.title: Nice, but slightly lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sent another couple down that way in November, and they agreed with our review as well.
reviews.title: Brand New Property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were very happy with our stay at Drury Inn. We were there for two nights while I did some family history research. Couldn't beat the price at $99 a night. Check-in was quick and efficient. I had reserved a king deluxe room, but was given a very large handicap access room. The room had a nice LG flatscreen tv. We always appreciate not having to watch tv from the bed, so the lazyboy type chair was a nice touch. The bed was comfortable. The free breakfast in the morning and cocktail hour with appetizers (no need to go out for dinner) were terrific!! Great experience!
reviews.title: Terrific hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was great and came just when we needed it on the highway.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Drury in Sikeston, Mo within an 8-month period. After a long, nervewracking drive in snowy weather, we were very happy to return to this hotel knowing what we would expect - a warm welcome at the front desk and quick check-in. The breakfast consists of hot and cold items, varied selection of pastries, cereals, fruit, etc. No one should leave hungry. The common areas of the hotel and the grounds are kept immaculate. The rooms are spacious and clean; beds are very comfortable. Each room has a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot. We stayed again on our trip back through the area and enjoyed their new 5:30pm Kick-back buffet which included free drinks - wine, beer, liquor - and hot appetizers which change daily, a meal in itself. Free internet and long distance are just another bonus. This is a MUST STOP for any traveler looking for a restful and relaxing experience.
reviews.title: This hotel has everything ... comfort, hospitality and friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it was halfway (on our road trip), and it had good reviews, and it took pets. (our pet room was not a smoking room!) THANK YOU. We stayed there one night, a week apart, each way on our trip. Having dogs, it's hard to go out to eat after driving 8 hours and leave them alone in a hotel room ...with Drurys evening meals and breakfasts it solved our issue. This is the best hotel we've had the pleasure of staying in with our pets. Many other people were swimming with their kids in the pool. The staff was professional and friendly, very clean hotel, and we thought our room was huge! Great bathrooms...sooo clean and new. Very tastefully decorated. Thank you! We will use Drury again and have already recommended them.
reviews.title: Very accomodating even for our dogs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brand new, clean hotel. Front desk and person who ran the evening cocktails and snacks were very friendly. This hotel has already started the evening snacks of hot dogs, baked potatoes, chicken strips and various other choices. Stayed at a couple of other Drury hotels in other locations during our trip, and they did not have this option yet. There was enough food in the evening to make a meal, which made it well worth spending a few dollars more than neighboring hotels. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great stay

aka: Drury Inn & Suites - Sikeston Hotel Sikeston
description: Drury Hotel offers its guests a variety of free extras – take, for example, our free hot breakfast. At Drury, “hot” means scrambled eggs, biscuits & gravy, sausage and make-your-own Belgian waffles. In the evening, join us at our 5:30 Kickback® for free hot food and cold beverages. Our rotating menu features a variety of hot foods, baked potatoes, garden salad, beer, wine, mixed drinks and more! To burn off all of those free extras, Drury has a 24-hour exercise center and a parking lot to jog around. Lastly, Drury’s free wireless Internet and free long distance calls will ensure you can keep tabs on all of your posse back home.
